body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Ky,

Your Petition Ann Leghorn States that at the last term of the City Court of Louisville She was tried in an indictment for Keeping house found Guilty & fined Twenty dollars She States she is widow has three Small Children and is very Poor and utterly unable to pay the fine, She says winter is here with all its hardships on the Poor and she will unless your Excellency interposes, be taken from her Children and sent to the Woorkhouse, She most humbly Prays your Excellency to remit the fine
The undersinged most earnestly unite the Prayer of Petitioner

R H Rousseau
T L Jefferson
F C Welman
Thos Jefferson
A H vanderslouis
J H Kellar M. D
P. F. Smith
Richard H Rudd M. D.
J. B. F Gray
J. M Stephens J. P. J. C.
Peter Riley
J, P, Gailbrott
A, H, McKay
Wm Wilson

F. C Forsythe
James Harris
Rev W W Owen
H, G, Rowland
J. Kuhn
Jacob Pfalzer
R M Pomeroy
J. A Wigger
T S Muir
M Pyles
Please grant the prayer of the petitioner and return to the address of your

Louisville City Ct
Remitted
B. M
$20.
Ann Leghorn
Issd Jany 17. 1861
